text: 750ml bottle 2008. Cork 2010 but hard to read. Nose big fruity notes. Awesome funk. Taste great fruity notes. Finish a bit lactic. Big sourness. Pretty intense carbonation. Very nice. Still quite fruity after all this time.

Bottle Lou pepe framboise 2013 at the brewery. Strong raspberry, musky.. Light barley, sour raspberry. Long beautiful aftertaste of fruit deliciousness and tartness. This is one of my favourite beers to date. Would drink anytime.
Bottle - Petroleum and dark raspberry. Deep opaque red with a pink head. Dark raspberry fruit, light oetroleum funk and a nice finish. Solid and complex.
2014 Framboise at the brewery. Pours clear raspberry-red, with 1 finger carbonation. Fresh, yet earthy raspberry in the nose. Very sharp and a little unbalanced acidity. Finish was crisp and sour.

Bottle at cantillon, thanks random Americans! Pours hazy pinkish red. Nose is really fruity raspberry. palate is intense raspberry jam, strawberry, cherry, wood, just a bit sour. Sour and fruity finish. So good, the most Drinkable beer Ive had to date!!!!!! Maybe even better than Im rating it here, but only had ten minutes for 5 of cantillons best, so some nuances are probably lost one me.

Sample at Ölrepubliken during GBG Beer Week 2017. Hazy pink red with off white pink head. Smell is wonderful with fresh raspberries, sour berries and light funk. Taste is a lot of sour berries and fresh raspberries. Dry, medium to high acidity with low to medium bitterness and medium carbonation.

Butelka 2013, butelkowane w 2016, bottlesharing w Piwotece. Aromat świetny, dużo malin i funku. Smak mocno kwaśny, praktycznie dominuje i przesłania sporo głębi lambika. Trochę za młode, potrzebuję kilku lat.

750ml bottle pours out red topped with a pinkish head. Nose is amazing raspberry jam sweetness complex barrel funk. Taste is more of the amazing raspberry sweetness the classic cantillon house funk. This one is great.

750ml bottle shared with Ben, Seb and Jo. Aroma: intense raspberries, oaky, some sweetness perceptible from the nose, some blueberries and other berries, light raw wheat. App: cloudy peach / pinkish, minimal white head. Taste and palate: light body, moderate carbonation, moderate acidity dry. Overall: this is quite dry. But I like it. I think aging this one really cut the sweetness. Its a bit sweet but not over the top which I like. Great fruitiness too. Like it a lot. Not my favorite fruity Cantillon but not far. Great stuff.

UPDATED: DEC 24, 2016 Bottle shared by Alex drank with the boys A: tart raspberries, vinous, light wood, some other red fruits. App: hazy orange pink small white head t/p: thin to med body with moderate to long acidic finish . Med high carbonation. A bit acetic, but done nicely, not over the the top. O: Now this is really nice the barrel paired really well with the fruit. Much enjoyed. Glad my friend decided to share that with me ill try to pay him back with some vintage Breughel or something.

Poured from a 750 ml, 2016 vintage bottle. 
Aroma is bright and fruity with a fairly jammy with lots of raspberry notes. Some light herbal phenolic notes with faint oak. 
Pours a bright, purple red with a medium sized, somewhat pink head that recedes to a thin film that lingers on the edges. No lacing or legs. 
Flavor is fairly acidic with a light sharpness and a medium light sweetness. Fairly strong raspberry notes with some jamminess to it. Light herbal and leafy phenolic notes. Light oak. Some citrus notes in the acidity. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, its fairly acidic with some sharpness to it. Very jammy at first but but then some more phenolic and earthy notes come through.

Botella @El Lúpulo Feroz, Oviedo 16/12/2016.
Color rojizo, sabor fruta, frambuesa, final acido, cuerpo medio, rica.

2013 bottle at akkurat, stockholm. Dark red color, small reddy head disappears quickly. Aroma has raspberries, sour notes, stables notes. Balanced sweet and sour body, raspberries, sour, berries. Its as good as they speak.

Aroma of raspberries, forest fruits, cellar, oak, red grape. 
Pours a nice deep red with a slightly foamy head. 
Taste follows the nose with loads of raspberries, oak and some vinegar note. Not that much funk. Medium sweetness and a light tartness. 
Medium body, a bit syrupy mouthfeel, average carbonation, fruity and oaky lightly drying finish. 
This one had a bit of the syrupy consistency but nothing too crazy.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Cudo. Świeżutkie maliny prosto z krzaka, krzak maliny, dużo Brettów, słodki aromat. Mega wytrawne, owocowe. Genialne.
Flaska från Beergium. Massor av friska syrliga hallon i doften. Smaken är också intensivt präglad av hallonen, riktigt torr med kanske lite väl vass aningen acetisk syra, men annars riktigt bra.

Thanks Huhzubendah for sharing the bottle! Poured into a snifter showing cranberry red with a finger of the same red tinged white foam. 

The nose shows light rapsberries with the typical strong bretty funk. 

The palate is highly carbonated and medium bodied. Highly tart with dry raspberries in the background and on the front end. Nice and simple.

Deep red colour with smallish head on top. Aroma has of course raspberries, a lot of sweetness and sourness too. Taste is raspberries. Sweet at first but nice punch of sourness in the end. Medium body and medium carbonation. Really great fresh raspberries.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
Perky red. Wow, funky aroma! Does the oak bring almost smoky aroma? Porridge. Fresh berry. Real raspberry. Delicate and sophisticated.

1998 version in 2016. hazy Amber red color. Fantastic nose of raspberry with the fruit so well defined even after 18 yrs, so delicate with some oak, funky, horse blanket. Amazing condition, tart without being over the top. The beer is basically perfect for what it is. The raspberries just linger for ever at the finish and balance out the acidity with sweetness. Amazing.

Bottle 2013. Hazy red pour with pink head. Aroma is fresh and sour with significant raspberry. Taste is balanced with significant bitter notes at the end. Some hay and barn mixed with the fruity freshness. Light body

Bottle. Pours hazy red with pink head. Tart raspberries, vinegar, wood, red fruits, barnyard. In taste dry, tart with sour-sweet raspberry note, wood, barnyard and light vinegar in finish. Light body, fizzy carbonation, sour raspberries in finish. Great.

Pours a hazy purple red from the bomber with thin ring of pink head that leaves light lace. Aroma of fresh tart raspberries with a big overlying funk. Taste follows, funk, acidity, fruit galore. Really well balanced, complex, awesome.

Mooi roze-rood van kleur met parelend witte schumkraag die langzaam inzakt. Héél scherp en zurig in de neus (tot het azijnachtige aan toe). Maar als je een slok neemt gebeurt er iets wonderbaarlijks. Het lijkt alsof dit bier in je mond explodeert. Opeens komen er allerlei smaken vrij van rood fruit, frambozen, aardbei. Net alsof deze fruiten open poppen in je mond. Zaligmakend gevoel is dat. Heel veel mensen zijn euforisch over dit bier en kan dit wel snappen. Uitzonderlijk lekker !!
UPDATED: FEB 5, 2017 Pours a murky raspberry red with a pink lacing. Huge raspberry and vinegar nose, some grape. Super acidic and rather tart wth a slightly sweet finish

Large shared 2013 bottle.
Looks great, with a deep red body. 
Moderately high tartness. Hints of raspberry and strawberry jam. Very fruity aroma.

Medium high carbonation in a medium light body.

A 750ml bottle at the brewery. 2013 sticker, bottled on 3rd April 2016. Poured into a Cantillon tasting glass. It poured a clear dark ruby colour with a three finger dark pink head that had decent retention and some sparse lacing. Looks so good. Aromas of fruity raspberry, strawberry and some light floral notes. Tastes sour, tart, raspberry, strawberry, oak, apple and light barnyard funk. Dry, light bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall, this was just so good. Such nice refreshing raspberries and strawberries. Could very well be my favourite fruit lambic! Must buy.

2002 vintage at RBSG. Sour lactic and berry, funky - great nose. Muted ruby clear with no head. Medium body with medium carbonation. Super tart raspberry acids, lactic with moderate Brett funk. Huge sour finish and mouth watering sour after.
2012 Dark red purplish color. No head. Low carbonation acetone and raspberries nose. Medium mouthfeel. Super jammy raspberry flavor with barnyard funk and a long sweet and sour finish

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2017 2011 bottle in 15 in Brussels, 2013 bottle in 17 here in DK. Wow. Barnyard aroma, tart raspberry jam taste with some oak, a perfect sour fruit (lots of fruit here!!!) and funky mix. The best Cantillon fruit lambic? Maybe. Better than Blåbær, better than Lou Pepe Kriek, but then again I havent tried the cloudberry. But honestly it doesnt matter, most Cantillons are perfect and this is just top class.

Bottle at Cantillon. Pink color. Nice aroma of fresh raspberries, oak and some vanilla. Taste is delicious, with lots of fresh raspberries, mild oak, vanilla, wheat and somekind of awesome smoothness. Amazing lambic.

Bottle Vintage 2010. Frothy white good mostly lasting head. Red colour, Light malty and hoppy powerfull acetic raspberry aroma. Moderate sour nice acetic raspberry flavor. Long finish. Creamy palate. Nice.
Bottle at RBSG 2002. Pours a clear amber color with almost no. The aroma and flavor have crazy sour raspberry character, oak, acidic, some citrus, biting, not for someone new to sours.

15th January 2016Thatll be me 20K then @ ChrisOs. Thanks to ?. One of those how the hell have I not rated this? beers! Hazy cherry red beer, good pink head. Palate is light and dry, decent fine carbonation. Tart lemony sourness. A little cherry - raspberry tartness that develops a kind of cherry acid. Acid lemony finish. Too sharp for me.
Duft kraftig kirsebær rød frugt svag stikkelsbær smag syrlig rød frugt tør hindbær rød frugt

From 75 cl bottle, 2011 and 2012. 2012: Aroma of a lot of raspberry. Dark red colour with off-white head, not lasting. Heavy sour from berries. Light body, dry feel, sour raspberry finish. 8/10 - 4/5 - 7/10 - 4/5 - 16/20.
2011: Aroma is more yeasty, less and older raspberry than 2012. Colour has turned more orangey. Taste is only moderate sour and light bitter - some of the berry sourness has disappeared. Light+ body, dry feel, old sour berry finish. 7/10 - 4/5 - 7/10 - 5/5 - 15/20.
2012 added.

Bottle 2012 vintage, Smag på Øllet Lambic smagning @ Cafe Albert. Pours red with a fading pink/offwhite head. Aroma of sourness, yeast, barnyard, rich tart fruity, rich raspberries. Flavor is rather sour, barnyard, yeast, light vinegar, rich tart fruity, sour fruity, tart raspberry. Medium body, average to lively carbonation, lasting fruity dry and acidic finish. 8-4-8-4-17. 110616 
Bottle, Smag på Øllet Lambic smagning @ Cafe Albert. Pours red with a fading offwhite head. Aroma of sourness, barnyard, yeast, wood, leather, light dusty, tart raspberries. Flavor is light sourness, yeast, barnyard, wood, light leather, weak mold notes in the back, sweet and light tart raspberries. Medium body, soft to average carbonation, light acidic finish. 7-4-8-3-15 110616

Bottle @ Cantillon, Brussels 20160507. [ Vintage 2013 ]. Bretty and fruity, woody and acidic, raspberries, light to medium body with a watery texture. The finish is dry/tart, fruity and woody with raspberries.
Red bronze pour. Aroma tangy raspberries slight vinegar. Tastes balanced balsamic sour, raspberries. Even slightly seedy. Great balanced tartness. I think the fruit helps

Bottle, sourced from the brewery. 2011 vintage so not drunk young by any stretch! Pink fading to brown colour. Restrained matured funk. Fruit has mellowed and blended with the winey acidic notes of the lambic. Sharp and yet not vinegary or mouldy. Serious stuff.
Shared bottle. Thanks to Nikos! Pours a nice dark red with a small pink head. Aroma of tart fruit and funk. Taste is raspberries, apples, other fruit, funk, mild vinegar, and wood. Excellent.
Bottle @ cantillon brussels. Pours a clear red colour beer with a medium head. Fruity with a lot of rasberries, some brett and wood. Well balanced sourness very nice. Dry finish

One of my favorite Cantillon beers. It pours a nice deep red color and has a nice head that settles quickly. Very nice mouthfeel and has a strong nose of raspberries and fruit. Sweet but not cloying and it has great balance.

(bottle) slightly opalescent ruby colour with a frothy pink head. aroma of heavy raspberries, herbal hops and gooseberries, quite leafy, with a light touch of vanilla, some light barnacles, flan base and lemon juice. flavour is mostly raspberries and lemon juice, with some notes of salted popcorn, vanilla and black olives in the medium-dry tart finish. medium-bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle shared by Linus - thanks! Ruddy pinkish brown pour, head flourishes and dies in a second. Aroma of funk and fruit. Dusty raspberry; exceptionally tart preceded by initial sweetness. Lovely, but definitely tart. I had it to my wife and she shakes her head "no. Too sour." More for me - both of these ounces are mine!

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2017 Sampled at ACBF 2017, Vichte. Hazy burgundy red with no head and visible carbonation. Notes of macerated raspberries, fresh raspberries, tart cherries, minerals/salt, lambic funk, barnyard, champagne-like dryness, grapes. Superb, yet again!
Sampled at a tasting. Dark ruby pour with a small pink head. Smells of raspberries and lambic funk, cherries and cherry cores. The taste is impossibly sour, but of a fruity type, not vinegar-y, with tons of raspberries and some cherries in the mix. Crazy!

Murky dark red color with pink head. Aroma is full of fresh raspberries and some farmhouse funk. Taste starts with intense sourness and raspberries in the background. Extremely dry, light body with a good amount of carbonation. Excellent fruit aroma but the intense sourness overwhelms the other flavors.

Bottle at De Heeren Van Liedekercke, march 12th 2015. Hazy red body with a pink head. Aroma is strong of raspberries, light citric, funky. Taste is sour, quite sour, but balanced very nicely by the large amount of raspberries here, still acidic and cheesy but as fruity as they come. Long dry tickling berry finish. A masterpiece, the berries are very well blended into the lambiek.

Big cherry red body with a finger of pink vibrant foam. Palate leads with funky raspberry forward notes, some underlying pickle and vinegar, barnyard funk, tannic dryness grips midpalate and leads into the finish. Wet oak lingers.

UPDATED: OCT 2, 2016 Pale transparent red colour. Pinkish head. Really powerful and clear raspberry aroma. Raspberries all the way. Vinegar and raspberries again. So nicely balanced. Incredable.

Lou Pepe Framboise 2012. Bottled on 24 march 2015. Hazy reddish-brown colour. Acidity, raspberries, raspberry seeds, vinegar in the aroma. Lots of raspberries, acidity, raspberry seeds in the taste. Acidic to dry palete. Light bodied, crisp, sharp, sparkling, amazing framboise.

750ml bottle pours dark ruby red with a finger of pink head. Big jammy raspberry juice, dusty oak, toasty spice, farm, hay. Some nice funky fruit sweetness with drying oaky vanilla and wood spice. Spectacular!
Misschien heb ik hem te jong gedronken, maar vond dit wel een heel zuur bier. Tegen het acide aan.

Bottle from Sabine for my birthday - many thx Maam cons 2016-02-13 Göteborg - vintage 2012, cork 2015!
AR: vineager, tart raspberries and black currants
AP: bourbon ruby, fizzy wee bubbly dark pink deminshing foam
F: tart, kriek youghurt, raspberries, raspberries seeds, black currant leafes, sour citrus,

Bottle share at Kennys 20K. Thanks to Dave for bringing this one along. As Cantillon Lou Pepe Framboise, 5%, 2012 vintage. Vibrant dark red, opaque, small foamy light pink head. Aroma is raspberry, souring apple core, a little papery. Body is medium, a bit foamy, tingly carbonation, tooth-rot. Taste is raspberry, dry, tangy, some vinegar, puckering sourness and some paper in the finish. Was hoping for a little more, but decent.

Bottle from 2012 shared @ Le Bloempot, Lille - FR, during Cantillon food pairing event - Color: deep dark red beer with some purple reflection no carbonation and white effervescence when served. Smell: :domination of raspberries, red fruits strawberries notes. Good balance with acidity and sourness. Very interesing nose. Taste: superb fruity taste. Raspberries and red frutis notes. Very intensive and well balanced with the sourness of the lambic. Good attenuation. Astringent finish. Aftertaste: nice raspberries attenuation good astringent. Amazing.

Deep ruby red, somewhat cloudy, frothy pink head. Tart aroma of raspberries, funk, lemon, and a little hay. Moderately tart taste with high carbonation. Body is perhaps a little more than light. Long finish of funk and fruit.
2012 version at the brewery. Tart, sour, barnyard, brett, raspberry, fruity, sour, balanced, awesome.

2012 bottle. Pours a cloudy dark red with a fading bubbly light pink head. Aroma of ripe raspberries, hint of vanilla, natural yoghurt, really tart and sweet. Taste is of raspberries, really tart again, zesty, long sour finish. Hard carbonation, sticky oily mouthfeel. Delicious.

At Maakuns. The cannon is out and pours a dark pink/red glass with a head that shows a nice gradient from white to pink top to bottom. Smell of bruised fresh raspberries. Amazing deep raspberry aroma. More raspberry flavor than raspberries themselves. Strong and fierce sour with sweet fruit notes. Beautiful stuff! Massive thanks! ;-) best framboise beer up to point.

Ma première Cantillon qui déborde (gushe) un peu lors de louverture! Elle est, en effet, plutôt carbonnatée et la mousse demeure un bon bout. Au nez cest très vinaigré et on reconnait, en plus des évidentes framboises, la cerise et le raisin rouge. Les notes en bouche me laissent perplexes.. Ça penche beaucoup vers le côté "vinaigre" et pas assez sur le côté sauvage/grange à mon goût. Il manque un peu déquilibre à ce niveau, à mon avis. Il faut dire que je préfère clairement les gueuzes non fruitées, en partant. Ça se laisse quand même boire comme une championne! Bref, une bière pour amateurs de gueuzes fruitées très sûres.

0,75l fles gedeeld op O-N 15-16. Dieppaarsrood met een roze kraag. Een zweem van frambozen in geur en smaak maar bovenal het volle aroma van wilde gisten zuur en ziltig met een enorme Body. Dit Is echt briljant.

Das Aroma ist über allem erhaben, denn diese Himbeeren scheinen direkt vom Stock zu kommen und leicht in Alkohol angelegt zu sein. Wow, was ein Hammer. Leider kann der Geschmack nicht ganz dort hin tendieren, denn zu viel Essig macht sich breit und bietet eine dermaßen brutalen Säure, dass Fruchtigkeit und Süffigkeit schnell verschwinden. Mit etwas weniger Perlung finde ich es das Bier milder und viel einfach zu genießen.

Bottle from Rudat in Dortmund. The beer has got a deep hazy pink-red colour with a medium body. Aroma of unripe raspberries, vinegar and acid. Taste of unripe raspberries, raspberry vinegar, citric, acid and unripe red berries. Very sour and vinegar-like finish.
Bottle. Pleasant and distinct aroma of raspberries. Taste refreshing and mouth puckeringly sour with long aftertaste.

Pours deep purplish pink with a small beige/pinkish head. Nose: sweet bonbon raspberry, a tart vinous feel, also lemon freshness with full raspberry jam. Awsome nose. Thick oily mouthfeel that builds in the mouth. Very fresh initially. Taste: Very fresh again, very tart, very sour and very fruity. Big sour, spicy raspberry, vanilled oak and extremely mouthcoating. Fruity aftertaste that leads to a tart and drying finish. Love!

From notes on 9/10/15. Was able to buy a 2012 Lou Pepe Framboise for on premise consumption only at Cantillon. Heck of a deal at 14 euro. Must say wow, this is easily the best Lambic/sour beer Ive had. Big sweet berry smell. Had a huge barnyard aroma that I like too. Tons of tart delicious raspberry flavor. Just one freakin awesome beer.

How: Draught.
Where: Akkurat, Stockholm.
Appearance: Hazy red colour with a pink head.
Aroma: Raspberries, fruit, sour, funk, apples.
Body: Medium body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Raspberries, funk, sour, fruit, some tart.

Pours hazy red with a pink head that quickly disappears. Aroma; Sour with rasberry, oak wood, tart and hay. Flavours; sour rasberry, wood, blackberry and gooseberry tones and grapes with a sour lime like finish.

Bottle: 2011
Bright red with a pinkish-white head.
Raspberry, woody aroma.
Taste is tart ,rich, raspberry, oak....very smooth...
Really bold flavour.....
Excellent.

750ml bottle enjoyed @ Dangerous Bottleshares - WHLZBRZ-edition. Pours beautiful hazy red with an off-white/pinkish head. Aroma is sour, raspberries, hay, barnyard and wood. Flavour is very sour and funky. Medium bodied, thin texture, fizzy carbonation. Finish is tart and very sour. I would have liked a more clean raspberry flavour.

750mL bottle pours a murky amber brown with a pinkish hued white head. Aroma of sweet musky raspberry jam. Taste of mildly tart dry raspberry, yeast, and oak, pleasantly sour. Nice balance, tart and sour aspects hit just the right spots. Raspberry very present in the tart sense. Awesome, very tasty!

75cl bottle, tasting @ Chez Alain, Rennes. Hazy pinkish and sparkling. Raspberry is very obvious, with usual tart and funk. Awesome how the fruit taste is preserved and well integrated into the lambic.
Glass in moeder lambic. Cherry red color with red froth head. Lemon, raspberry, white wine, grape Aroma. Flavour is tart, raspberry, lemon,. Dry white wine finish. Tart lemon aftertaste. Lovely.

Bottle sampled at a beer tasting.
No head or carbonation. Murky burgundy pour. Raspberry tartnesss.
nice rasberry aroma,red, cloudy, red foame,light sweetness, medium sourness, medium body, oily feel, sour rasberries nice harmonic finish.

2012: 
Dark red coloured and unclear. Has a pink head, medium duration. Acidic aroma, fruity notes, raspberries,

2012 bottle at Akkurat. Bright pink color with quickly diminishing pinkish/white head. Lovely aroma of raspberries, oak and some funk. Taste is raspberry upfront with some tart cranberry/cherry notes behind. Fairly light body and carbonation. Tart raspberry finish.

2012 bottle at Cantillon, Brussel. Aroma of sour raspberry, barnyard funk, tart red fruits, wood. Flavour is absolutely out of this world, huge raspberry sour with a dry sour finish. Body is medium, very lively carbonation. Stunning raspberry Lambic!

Bottle at Cantillon! Pours hazy red with a white head. Aroma of raspberries, tartness, fruits, a bit of currants, wood, funk. Taste is through the roof! Fruity as f*ck, red berries, lots of raspberries, wood, sooo tart, funky, super dry. Full body with a looong finish. Im in heaven.

Pours red, with a pink head. Aroma is raspberries, and the taste is of sour raspberries. Body is on the thin side. It doesnt really taste like beer, more like a raspberry cider. Glad I was able to try it.

Bottle of 2012. Red body with rose head. Aroma has strong raspberry sweet character, other berries in the background. Taste has high sour acidity, fruity of berries, little bit tart. Very well balanced. Body is full, medium carbonation.

Bottle at cantillon. Pours deep red with a pinkish head. Aroma of tart, heavy sour, sour raspberry, barn, earthy, maeby the young fruits, makes it a bit earthy. Still very complex and extreme balance and sourness.

Bottle at a tasting. Deep cherry colour, hazy. Rather high carbonation. Very rich and long lasting flavour. High sourness but nicely blended with the raspberry, which is rather subtle and complementary. Easily drinkable despite the high sourness. Excellent.

750 ml bottle 2012 vintage, shared by Mmahut at Bratislava Tasting, many thanks!
Deep ruby body, with a medium, frothy, pink head.
Aroma of funk, cheese, sour raspberries, sour apples, barrel, vinegar, some pears.
Tastes of wooden barrel, funk, vinegar, sour raspberries, sour apples, pears.
Medium, a bit oily mouthfeel, with a lively carbonation.
Finishes sour, dry, wooden, fruity, mainly with sour raspberries.

Tasty. Usually this is too sour for me, but this has so much character. Wonderful sour raspberry notes. Another outstanding Cantillon.
Bottle. Rouge colour, rouge head. Aroma is mostly fruity, raspberries, fresh, sour, barnyard. Raspberries in front. Taste is very sour, nice raspberries taste. Lingering sour taste. Very good beer.

Foggy red body with light pink head. Smells very sour, wild berries, marzipan, bread, spices, vinegar, some red apples. Has too much carbonation and extremely sour taste. Almost as strong as vünegar. Personally, smell is really nice but drinking this beer is hurting me!

0,75l bottle shared by mmahut at Bratislava RB Tasting, big thanks. Vintage 2012. very red cloudy color, small white head. smells rather sour, green apples, some nuts, almonds, marzipan, funk, rather sour smell, except from the green apples no other fruits noticeable. medium body, very bubbly carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes sour, marzipan, almonds, some fruits, green apples, citric, very light raspberry and berry notes. finishes sour quite dry, with green apples, and some funk. decent stuff, very strong carbonation, its helps a bit with the sourness, but still a bit much for me. overall rather sour a bit too much so for me.
Bottle at joined tasting at Gurthnars place. Red color with small pink head. Raspberries, red wine, wood, light funk in aroma. Nice raspberry taste with red wine, wood. Very tasty.
Bottle at Joined Slovak&Austian ratebeer session 10/2015. Pours red color, pink head. Aroma is sour, raspberries, strawberries. Taste is sour, raspberries, strawberries, lemon, citrusy.

Bottle. Hazy orangish color with white head. Aroma sour and funky. Sour with bitter Finnish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Had many times, brewery and bottle. Pour a burgundy color with a quickly fading white head. Oak and funk and some rose character in aroma. Prickle tart initially and then some molasses sweetness. Continued tart and some sour raspberry. So complex.

Sample from bottle, on Zwanze Day 2015 @ Bagbys, courtesy of Rip Currents brewer, with richiesd etc. Color is quite clear, pinkish red. Pink head. Aromas: sour, raspberry, light almond. Retronasal its sour, fruit, raspberry, light almond, light funk. Flavor is sour, with some sweet fruit. Light bodied. Finish is slightly funky and dry.
Muddy brown red color with no foam. The smell is sweet and has a heavy raspberry nose. The taste has a discrete sourness, a sweet fruitiness and a solid carbonation. Sour and fruity aftertaste.
Framboos rood met een snel verdwijnend roze schuim kraag. Ruikt framboos, limonade, zuur. Smaakt goed zuur, framboos.

750ml bottle (v2011) at Nüetnigenough, Bruessels. Hazy ruby red color with pinkish head. Aroma is funky and tart fruity, raspberries, citrus, barnyard. Sweet, bitter and acidic taste like aroma. Light to medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Deep raspberry aroma, almost black cherry and blackcurrant reminiscent. Fruit bomb, not as much complexity but very good with what it has, as it warms up some earthiness comes forward, not a lot of the traditional barnyard qualities, but very good nonetheless.

Red light pour. Aroma is massive raspberries, mild tang. Taste is the same with perfect balance between fruit and tang. Great lambic, not quite the complexity of lou pepe kriek as fruit takes over more here but super delicious and solid.
UPDATED: OCT 16, 2015 2012 Bottle at the brewery. Very tart, raspberry, oak, some dried dark fruits, grains noticeable. Nice. Grapefruit juice.

Bottle at Zwanze Day Zurich, 2003 vintage. The best raspberry sirup I ever had. Wait no, Im kidding. But it is damn good, has a strong raspberry flavour and its unbelievably dry. No sweetness at all.
At Grale House. Translucent red with small pink head. Aroma is sour raspberries, light body, medium carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is nice rich sour raspberry.

11-SEP-2015, 2012 bottle @Cantillon, with Ulkløbben.
Hazy red with pink head. Beautifull.
Real raspberry, tart, funk. Not a lot to say. This is just a wonderfull raspberry drink.
25.4oz bottle. Cloudy reddish-peach skin hue. Red plum, tart raspberry, plastic glue & cranberry nose. Complex sour taste w/all of the above. Medium body and full carbonation.
Bottle. Reddish colour with pink head. Raspberry, fruity aroma. Sweet, raspberry, acidic, sour, fruity taste. Medium body.

Bottle at the brewery. Smells of tart raspberries and oak. Opaque raspberry color with off white fine head. The very fruity raspberry flavor balances the acidity perfectly allowing notes of wood, vanilla, dried fruit, and wheat to emerge. Very dry finish with fruit pectin like coating. 
Best Framboise I have tasted. Need to compare to 3F and Rubicite.

2011 bottle at Nuetenough. Poured clear bright burgundy with pink head. Aroma sweet raspberry, berries, berry rind cherry yeasts. Light carb med bod. Tastes tart sour acidic raspberry juice, lingering dry berry pulp.
Lou Pepe Framboise at the Brewery. The aroma is a woodsy bark and raspberries on a beautiful pink body with pink foam. Prickly round carbonation. The taste is tart berries, wheat and hay. Great.

Bottle at cantillon, rate #4kpours deep claret red with fluffy white head. Zippy carbonation carries aroma of tromp through raspberry field freshly spread with manure. Sharp, spritzy, tart, fruity, battery acid, hay, raspberry, bubbley, moreish

2008 sticker bottle in trade from Pushkinwow...thanks man! Pours ruby red with some head. Cantillon funky raspberry aroma. Very tart and carbonated up from, sweet raspberry at the end. Simply one of the best lambics Ive ever had. Amazing!!

2008 bottle shared by Tom - thanks so much man! Hazy reddish purple pour with great carbonation. Raspberry, some funk, tart but still drinkable. Everything I want in a fruited lambic. This is beautiful.
Bottle at cantillon. Pours deep ruby purple, nose is raspberry, light funk, taste is dry, tart raspberry, funky, quite sweet.
2012 bottle at the brewery. Aroma of raspberry and crackers! Musty, nice fruitiness, sourness but more tart, ends with a bit of a fruity burn. Nice stuff.
Bottle at killer no filler. Pours pinkish, red brown with a pink head. Aroma is raspberry and slight citric. Taste is raspberries, slight citric and some funk. Medium carbo. 2010 bottle

Bottle at the DC Local Gathering on 8/1/2015, shared by Travlr. 2006 bottle. Hazy dark amber with off-white head. Aromas of funk, vinegar, light berries. Tastes of vinegar, berries, cherries, tart acidic notes. Medium-light body with a dry finish.
Bottle at Cantillon in Brussels. Shared with cards04 and northropfrye. Wow, I want to rate this so high! Like a raspberry garden!

750ml bottle, 2006 vintage shared by Travlr at the last DC Local Tasting. Pours a bright pink with some tight, white head. Nose is excellent, plenty of jammy berry, maybe not distinguishable as raspberry but sort of a mix berry cocktail, a whiff of candy, a solid but not distracting amount of horsey funk, a little brie, straw, some sweet tarts. Flavor follows right behind, that characteristically lemon Cantillon thing, grass, straw, some light grapefruit rind, then blue and raspberry, some cheesiness. Tart finish. Extremely well balanced. For those who think you cant age fruited lambics, think again. 7 years in the bottle and still plenty of fruit.

Originally reviewed 6/14/2013. 750 mL bottle poured into a wine glass. 2008, bottled April 12, 2011. Bright pink body. Faint pink head. Nice collar. Buckets of raspberry with a nice funk. Not a lot of acidity in the nose, just a bit. Bright raspberry flavor, but no sweetness. Tons of oak. Some sourness. Some funk. All raspberry in the flavor. Light body, extremely carbonated. Strong raspberry and not a lot of lambic complexity. Still very nice.
Bottle shared by Marcus. Pours red with pink head. Taste is lots of raspberry with a nice tartness.
Great stuff. Raspberry, grapefruit bretta. Hazy pink pour. Tangy finish. Fruity and wonderful. Big thanks to Travlr for sharing this one.

750ml bottle, thanks to Travlr, thank you Gene! Poured a carbonated, ruby cloudy color with a small persistent white head. Aroma was lots of raspberry, tartness. Lots of raspberry. Lots of carbonation. Amazing.
From a 50 cl bottle shared at the RB DC tasting Aug 1, 2015. Pours a cloudy pale reddish brown. Flavors of tart fruit. Intense tart finish.
Bottle from brewery . Nutty oak tart raspberry lactose . Dry rhubarb . Fantastic Lambic

Pours a stunning ruby red. Pink head. Aromas are fresh raspberries. Sugared raspberries. A touch of oak and funk. Flavours are very fresh and sour raspberries. Some sweetness. I almost taste the vine and soil from the raspberries. Exquisite.

Dégustée chez Cantillon en compagnie de Joey. Cheers buddy! Rouge, flamboyante, mousseuse, semi translucide, cette bière cest lété dans une bouteille! La mousse est interminable, sans être collante évidemment. Nez de framboises fraîches des champs sans le côté trop sûr ou trop sucré. Un bois léger, une acidité modérée, lambic adouci (vintage 2012) le tout dans un ensemble des mieux balancés et subtils. La bières est harmonieuse tout en étant franchement définie du côté framboise. Je ne suis habituellement pas amoureux des bières fruitées mais celle-ci ma tout simplement renversé. Merci Cantillon et Jean Van Roy!
2011 bottle shared by dedollewaitor, thanks a bunch. Deep red body with a dmedium pinkish head. Raspberries, light funk, vanilla notes and some. Very tasty.
Bottle. Cloudy pinkish-purple pour with a thin off white head. Aroma of raspberries, barnyard funk and white grapes. Thin velvety mouthfeel with a nice puckering sour finish.
Tart & sour. Great aroma of raspberry. Popped the Cantillon cherry. Lambic are different, and a bit of an acquired taste, but I could get used to them, if they're all gonna be as good as this.
Slightly hazy red pour with a white head. Massive jammy raspberry funk nose. Funky berry taste. Tart and complex. Excellent.

Awesome raspberries awesome dry dark cherries along with the predominate raspberries. The dry tartness over came flavor after the initial fruity presence. Exactly how it should be. Somewhat flat. Wonderful beer.

Lou Pepe Framboise 11 Vintage

Pours a very saturated, burgundy red color, with a soon disappating, fizzy head. 

Exhibit a fantastic smelling nose, with a very pronounced raspberry presence, blending perfectly into the tart acidity of the beer, establishing a reminiscence of young berries and young, fermented wine. Barnyard funk mingles together with prickly raspberry stones, tied together by a sweet, fruity undertone, exhibiting a gentle depth to the aromas. 

Has a medium carbonation and a very soft mouthfeel, with raspberry at every stage of drinking.

Tastes of unripe raspberries right from the beginning, wrapped up in leaves, moldy earth and tart funk - wild berries on an abandoned road during rain. This changes, as an earthy sweetness adds to the raspberries spending them a ripe note, including prickly, still sour stones. This fruity sweetness then stays on par with the bitterness on the palate till the finish, with the berries exhibiting a dusty earth note anong ripened, slightly fermented raspberry pulp, leaving behind a slick sourness.

The balance between ripe and young, sour raspberries, finding their quintessence in between, makes this beer noteworthy, featuring a lot of subtle Barnyard nuances.
Tasting with comparing LP against rose de Gambrinus. Loads of raspberry on the nose. Taste is excellent! Sweeter than the Gambrinus and absolutely more raspberry flavour.
Bottle 11 - pours a ruby red. Nose is funky, fecal, acidic, lemon zest. Taste is lots of raspberries, lemon zest, acidic and tart. Very good

Shared at a tasting hosted by Steebo on February 13. 2011 stickered 750 mL bottle. Oh man, been waiting for this one! The pour is a slightly haxy ruby color with a big light pink head that leaves some excellent lace and falls down to a small pile of foam in the middle of the beer. The aroma is beautifully raspberry with a nice great funk to it. Lots of hay and a great dankness to it. The flavor is great. Lots of bright raspberry and an excellent funk to go with the sharp crispness of the sour. The mouth feel is amazing. Light, but carbonated fully, lingering aftertaste, hugely bitter and then sweet on the back end. I love this beer!

2011 750ml Bottle at Nuetnigenough, Brussels, 12th May 15. Pours an impressive ruby red, pretty clear. Aroma is raspberries, fresh and captured at their prime. Taste is intense raspberries, well balanced not too sour, but traslt refreshing, slight funk, but the raspberries dominate. Great lambic
750 ml bottle 2011 sticker 2013 cork. Nose is loads of fresh, ripe raspberries and sour. Taste follows the nose, really nice, refreshing. Sourness lingers.

Bottle at Nuetnigenough in Brussels. Pours a beautiful clear ruby rose color with a whitish-pinkish head. Aroma is deliciously tart, sweet, raspberries, light funk. Similar flavor, good balance of sweet and tart. Definitely one of my favorite offerings from Cantillon.

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2016 Bottle at home for my birthday, 2011 label/2013 cork. Slight hazy pink/orange with big off white to pink head that leaves some nice island of bubbles. Lots of visible carbonation too. Musty raspberry, red berries, hay, straw. This has the most barnyard smell I have ever gotten in a beer, pure straw, earth, wood and some diesel fumes. Taste is medium strong sour, not really vinegary but fruity or red wine that is on its way too become vinegar. Medium bodied with very crisp feel and full prickly carbonation. Very good. 

Update 2012 label. Quite the same, a bit less diesel and barnyard, with some more fresh raspberry, especially on the nose. Amazing.
Poured red, smells like the wonderful winery characteristics . Dark fruit aromas and flavor, with breads yeast popping up. Great wet oak in background. Some barnyard but mostly great crisp tartness.
это пиво очень вкусно. я бы, конечно, рекомен& его всем. пожалуй& обратит& его. очень хорошо!
Bottle a dark red colored beer with a white head aroma raspberries candy apple sourness and some caramel flavor sourness fruits raspberries apple candy some caramel and a sourness aftertaste

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2015 2011 bottle. Lively hazy/unclear red with a quickly diminishing pink head. Raspberries can be smelled at a distance. Flavour has lots of raspberries too, but also a whole gosh darn lot of other things going on. Sour cherries, light almonds, barnyard, light leather, oak. Medium body, medium sweet and sour, light dry. Long sour finish with raspberries. Lord have mercy!

2001 vintage bottle. Big thanks to KL. Funky, dusty nose, very earthy, with berries, shoe polish, and a good modicum of horse blanket. Bright clear medium copper color. Very sharp initial, fermenting vegetables, fish flakes, and a persistent green olive strain from mid onwards. Very astringent, tongue-scraping mouthfeel. Varnish and vinegar, sour and powerful aroma and flavors. Takes a few sips for the palate to adjust to this one, but then wow! This vintage has held up so well.

(On tap @ Akkurat, Jan 4 2015) Pours deep reddish pink with a small pale pink head. Nice fresh raspberry forward, lactic, big wet hay for a fruit lambic, slight fresh cheese, bit herbal, nice. Flavour is tart raspberry juice, lactic with tart lemon and even orange peel, and a little dried grass in the bitter, softly acidic finish. The funk is more restrained in the mouth. Light with active carb. Really nice framboise! I almost wonder if this one is even better in bottle with more funk coming through on the palate. Either way its a good deal better than Gambrinus, just as one would expect.

Bouteille 750mL. Vintage 2011. Rouge-rose trouble, collet de mousse blanche. Nez tout en subtilité: framboise et vinaigre de vin rouge. Bouche légèrement tartrique, légèrement vinaigrée; framboises et un peu de bois. Un certain côté crémeux en bouche. Bonne.

Vintage 2013, dégusté après 1 an.
Odeur de framboise et de lambics. Le goût est légèrement acidulé avec une belle grosse poche de framboises. Lamertume est longue et fruitée. Dans les meilleures bières de Cantillon

750 ml bottle shared with the boys.Pours a veiled orangeish pink with a short lived white-pink head. Aroma is vinegar, raspberry, tart and wood. Flavor is raspberry, sour, vinegar. Finish has a woody and humid side. Medium body, average carbonation. Excellent.

Bottle from Beermoth, 2011 Vintage, thanks Emma! Ruby red, gentle carbonation, bright as a button. Pure raspberry jam aroma, fresh fruit purée, some acidity in evidence. Tart jammy raspberry, fruit seeds, lemon, intense sourness, then finishes like grinding raspberry pips between your teeth. Fantastic.

pours unclear bright red-pink with a very nice reviving pinkish head leaving nice lacing. tons of fresh raspberries, their seeds and leaves, red grapes and their astringency, zinfandel vinousness, raspberry vinaigrette - ponctuated by assertive and almost puckering acetic notes, appreciable level of funk although the fruit takes most of the place, shy but present oakiness, grass. bright carbonation,light body, grassy-spicy and sour citric-acetic finish. very nice raspberry but unfortunately almost crazy sour.
Bottle, thanks guys for sharing! Ruby red pour with a discreet pinkish head. Nose has raspberry jam with some light funk. Taste is jammy with raspberries, vanilla and some discreet funk. Tasty stuff!

UPDATED: JUL 14, 2015 Bottle. Pours slight hazy dark red with a pink fluffy medium head. Aromas of raspberries, slight yoghurt, some horseblanket, slight vinegar, some funky yeast. Taste is pretty sour up raspberries up front, pretty funky yeast, some horseblanket, some vinegar.
Bue en bouteille de 75cl. Bon, ce nest pas mon style de bière mais il faut bien avouer que cest un excellent produit, très bien fait. On sent la force du fruit, incroyable.

Really amazing framboise, had opportunity to compare it with Boons Farmbiose on tap, which tasted like sugar candy in comparrison. All you need to know is that it is a Cantillon framboise that beats Rosé de Gambrinus with a good amount. So yeah, gotta try it.

Bottle from unknown via Chris. 2009 vintage, fairly translucent ruby color, little bit of head. Aroma lactic, funky, vinous, buteric character as well. Body very sharply tart, tannic, but with a sickly sweet character underlying. Really nice!

Sour raspberry aroma spiced with piss & vomit. Very special but pleasant when it comes to all. Clear red with small pink head. At first sour but perfectly slightly sweet raspberry finish. Medium body, sticky texture & average carbonation.

Bottle, 2010 Vintage. Hazy deep red/ruby with big pinkish head. Aroma is malt, raspberries, tart, barnyard, funky and sour. Flavour is malt, raspberries, tart, sour, oak, barnyard, funky, little sweet, medium dry and a little almond.

750ml bottle served in a Lambic flute.
Bottled @ the 19th of January, 2010.
A: Beautiful bottle art, first of all. 750ml corked and capped bottle. Pours a cloudy dark rose color forming a huge and fizzy rose head. Small retention and practically no lacings left in the glass
S: Very fruity and sour. Funky. Strong noted of sweet pale malts, vinegar, leather and red fruits. Metallic and earthy Lambic yeasts in end. A raspberry bomb
T: Very fruity but quite dry and sour. Notes of sweet pale grains, red fruits and Lambic yeasts. Notes of leather. Metallic and earthy finish
M: Light body. Huge fizzy but quite faint carbonation. Fruity and sour aftertaste
O: Very drinkable. Cantillon pleasure
[ BA Review @ 7/13/2012 ]

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2017 Vintage 2003 - not much to say besides: Near perfect Cantillon. Not overwhelmingly framboise-smelling, but still very distinct. Dry. Dry. Dry. Sour. Sour. Sour. Fruits. Incredible. 4.9

Vintage 2003, again (at Zwanze 15). No residual sweetness at all. Not a single sugar molecule. Extreme fruitiness and long fruity finish and aftertaste. Extreme stuff, amazing stuff. A bit foamy carbonation.

Vintage 2009 shared at Zwanze 16. Similar in character,  quite some almonds as well. Mouth-puckering and very "minty" funky. Slightly sulphuric in the back. I might have overrated this one earlier ^^

Vintage 2013, finally a younger one! Shared with anstei at the source. So much funk and raspberry jam, as were used to. Taste is sour, raspberries still there, but lots of sourness. High carbonation. This is already quite aggressive, but the bugs haven?t killed *every* sugar molecule yet. I have to adjust my first rating, I was just too inexperienced back then. 10-4-10-4-18

Vintage 2013 again, so many thanks to Robbie from Tribaun! Jammier, dry, not too sour yet. Better than the one I?ve had at Cantillon. Amazing, a real masterpiece.

shared bottle with 2 friends. new batch from 2014 so nice and fruity. poured a light coloured ruby red colour with a pink head. aroma is very framboise forward, aplles, lemons, lemon zest, raspberries, barnyard, funk, very nice and tart! dry oaky finish, pretty dry tart finish. incredible combination of sourness and fruits. amazing! maybe my favourite cantillon seasonal by far.

Bottle: 2010 sticker. Bloody red body with crimson & copper tints; slightly lavender tinted head on top, pretty foamy but quick to settle to a lazy collar. Aroma of juicy raspberry, lacto lemon notes, funky wood, signature Cantillon critters, mild barnyard, lightly floral perfume, & a huge raspberry jam punch towards the finish. Juicy, jammy raspberry explosion on the palate. Fruity, tart, sour, & funky with a good bit of wood, lacto yeast, horsey funk, & mild sweat. Light acidity, some lemon flesh, & a sharp, finishing sourness. Puckering. A touch of yogurt in the back-end, finishing dry with lingering raspberry skins & soured wood. Insanely delicious beer.
2010 sticker. Ruby red pour. Sour. Sour and raspberry. Slight acidic. Nice and balanced. Good stuff. I think this was my favorite of the cantillon tasting.

2006 : A hazed pink Gueuze with a thin off white head. In aroma, beautiful raspberry jam with acidic notes, lactic notes, refreshing and complex, beautiful. In mouth, a wonderful tart Gueuze, loads of lactic acid, lemon, raspberry, light salty notes, beautiful and intense. #OttBottShare. Bieropholie import.

"As Id hoped, does for Framboise what the same year Lou Pepe did for Kriek. In short, one of the best, if not the best raspberry beer Ive had (though it costs several times as much as New Glarus, its main rival). beautiful ruby red pour w pink head. quite the gusher (the beer level actually lowered as the head rose for several minutes after a gentle pour). wonderful full raspberry farm aroma. flavor equal measures sour and fruit. near perfect. too steep to get often, but i will revisit if i can."
Smell was raspberries and maybe a tad bit of plastic. Sour raspberry taste that struck a great balance between the fruit and the sourness.
Bottle. Pours bright red/ pink with pink head . Aroma is strong raspberry, sweet, tart. Taste is very berry, very tart, lots of berry. Absolutely amazing!

Bue en bouteille de 75cl au Sherwood Pub (Nicorvo), couleur rose, belle mousse rose effervescence importante. Une bière acide sur la framboise la perfection de la balance entre le fruit et le lambic, une tuerie exceptionnelle !

Traditionally made framboise with fresh red raspberries; intended for export. Has all the barnyard funkiness and complexity of any of Cantillons best products; very sec, if not acid, but extremely clever balance between this neige lambic sourness and a ton of fresh, soft, gentle fruits; very long and dry finish, yet light on the tongue. Clearly one of the great masterpieces in lambic world, though I liked the kriek and the geuze in this series even better.

Bottle at Nüetnigenough, 2010 vintage. Pours hazy red with a pink head. Aroma is sweet and tart raspberries, light funk, oak, vanilla and grain in the background. Taste is tart and refreshing with distinct raspberries, light dry oak notes and barnyard in the background. Light/medium body.
750ml bottle at Parker Pie post-FoFA. Pours hazy pinkish. Aroma of funk and raspberries and light sourness and light oak. Incredible.

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2015 Burg shared this gem with everyone at the Swamp Head Batch 600 release. A huge want of mine. Thanks man! 2010 Sticker on this one pours bright red with a mostly white with a pink hued read on top. Aroma of barnyard funk, yeast, hay, dust, and big juicy raspberries. Flavor follows just the same with lots of dusty barnyard funk and plenty of juicy raspberries. Dry oaky finish. Body is light, pretty dry on the finish, and has medium plus carbonation. Oh yea. This is good. Glad I finally got to try it.

75cl hazy purple red with fluffy dissipating pinkish white head that leaves very light lace. Aroma of funky awesome fruit, lactic, tartness. Taste follows, nice framboise flavor, but not sweet, balanced with tartness wow. Bubbly and refreshing on the tongue, not overly sour. Amazing.

Bona cervesa, equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, equilibrada y sabrosa.

2011 vintage @ Nøgne Ø. 
Potent acidity - really sour, but yet balanced neatly with lots and lots of fruit. Refreshing and light, but yet complex beyond belief. Fantastic.
Amazing gueuze lambic, very complex and full of different tastes, so enjoyable, very sour, grains, cereals, wild fruity and flowery notes. Impressive!
Wonderful so fresh aroma ...it seems as they just went picking!!! What was real nice was the yeasty cellar olfactory sense while drinking this! I loved and still love this

0,75 l bottle kindly shared by Ole Anders on our train ride to Gvarv. Clear warm red body with a white rim. Nose most invitingly conveys the essence of freshly picked raspberries with a faint hint of vanilla. Fruit acids, grapefruit, raspberries and tannins in the mouth. Light to medium bodied. Well balanced and elegant. Perfection!
Bright pink translucent pour, pinkish white head. Nose is fresh raspberries and funk. Taste is fresh raspberries, tart berries, light funk but really all about the fruit. Body is very light.
@ Akkurat. A funky tart journey into flavors of cherries, raspberries and blackberries. Darker flavors from raspberries with the perfect funky touch and sourness.

Bottle 2013 vintage. Beautiful red pour with pinkish head. Aroma is barnyard, must and cheese along with raspberries, blackberries and flowers. Highly fruity and aromatic with a decent amount of funk. Taste is an intense multilayered fieldberry bomb: intense raspberries, cherries, blackberries and strawberries. Rich and consistent palate with med-lively carbonation. I tend to appreciate more and more the Lou Pepe Framboise and Kriek I found at first too funky and sour.

Pours deep ruby into a tulip with moderate head retention and noticeable lacing. Huge aromas of our raspberry jam and cheese dominate the nose. This shows huge almost undrinkable acidity in older renditions (2003) and a more modest approach in later batches up to current release, which as of last sampling in late 2013 was showing a musty barnyard note and very little of the acidity the early 2000s batches exhibit. A solid offering from the LP series, perhaps right in the middle for me..
Super bitter and fruity. Like grapefruit juice. Pine needles and tart. Not a bad one for the style

750 bottle shared by Michael. Thanks! Pours a bright reddish pink color with a white head. Aroma is huge raspberries, oak, vanilla. Medium on the palate with lively carbonation. Flavor is lightly sour, big raspberry fruit, oak, Cantillon funk, with a nice tart finish. Very nice.
Great framboise. Lots going on with the sour rich base and compliments and wrestles with the raspberry in a good way! Very balanced in the big richness of fruit and funk. I loved this brew
Red colour, pink foam. Low carbonation. Very complex aroma with notes of raspberries. Sweet nose, sour taste with light bitter finish. Very good and refreshing.
Bottle. Pours red, lots if head. Aroma if sour, fruits, sweetness, yum. Taste is the same. Fruity, tart, makes my nose hairs tingle, it makes me feel good. Want moar.

Bottle shared by Dan. Nose is slightly acidic with faint fruity notes. Taste is slightly fruity and moderately tart. Hits you in the chest a little. Just kinda, bland? I dunno, havent been a fan if these LP beers. Ok but not great.
Pours a murky reddish color. Foamy pink head. Huge funky barnyard sour aroma. Light fruit character. Sour, fruity, strawberry like flavor. Barnyard, funky yumminess.
2010 vintage bottle shared at the January 2014 tasting in Santa Cruz. Aroma is ridiculous. Huge vivid luscious raspberry. Rich berry flavor, dense blackberry especially, sour citric finish.

Murky dark pink with a light pink head. Aroma is raspberry, sour candy, a little barnyard funk. Tart on the palate, but not crazy - nice balance of sweet and tart, dry finish. Taste is raspberries, tart candy, hint of wood. Yum

Bottle at Beer Bistro in Toronto shared with ontbeertaster. Strong tar raspberry aroma surrounded us as soon as it was opened. Dark murky berry colour, large white frothy head. Lots of sour and tart raspberries up front, after the first few sips the sour mellowed a bit and became very drinkable, with tons of raspberry flavour. Amazing beer.

Bottle share by Max. 2001 vintage. This has pretty clearly suffered from age. It tastes like cheesy dirty fruity dump water. Big tart/sour oxidation, with some pungent funky grossness. Not good at all.

2007er Version, rated 2009.  Schöne leuchtendrote Farbe im Glas mit angenehm säuerlichem Himbeerduft. Der Antrunk ist angenehm säuerlich-holzig, mild mit fruchtiger Note. Der Hauptteil ist angenehm mild-holzig, moderate Säure, angenehm sauer-fruchtige Himbeertöne, die sich mit der holzigen Note lange bis in den Nachgeschmack halten.  Frisch-fruchtiges Bier, bei dem aber der letzte Teil des Nachgeschmacks teilweise doch etwas flacher wird, da die Säure schnell abfällt, die holzige Himbeernote aber bleibt. Trotzdem aber m.E. fruchtiger als das "normale" Rosé de Gambrinus. --> 14/12/13/13

Pours a deep red with a small pink head. Aroma is out of this world! So funky and cheesy! I could smell this glass for days! A nice tartness arises with aromas of ripe raspberry, some more funk, burnt rubber and hay. Taste is puckering tart, acidic and loaded with ripe berries. Some vinous notes creep in, along with some barrel notes. Such a kaleidoscope of flavors swirling around. The medium carbonation provides a lively, tart finish. Makes me crave the next sip!
2009 bottle pour at Teresas. Ruby red pour with pink head. Raspberry, apple, funk. Moderately sweet. High bitterness. Light, crisp body. My first Cantillon. Its reputation is well deserved.

Pours a dark candy red with a medium but quickly diminishing pinkish head that leaves some lacing. Nose is of hay, cork, funk and really acid. Taste is fruity and full of real raspberries, pits and everything else. It is really acid but in an elegant way, never harsh. Flavors of wood, mushrooms and plain ol funk (really cheesy). Body is light and it feels vinous overall. Carbonation is on the lower side. Nice!

Bottle 750ml @ Haakonm Pours red with a pink head. Aroma has notes of raspberries, barnyard, funk, tart. Taste is light sweet and heavy sour with and long dry, sour and raspberry finish. Body is medium, texture is thin, carbonation is soft to fizzy

Annata 2010. Un deciso sapore di lamponi che si lega allacidità morbida e rotonda che invade ogni angolo del palato. Avrei voluto, anzi dovuto, invecchiarla qualche anno ma, ho preferito seguire il consiglio degli antichi: carpe diem! E ne è assolutamente valsa la pena! Esperienza magggica!

Gorgeous bright red colour, brighter than any other beer Ive seen. Sour funk, flowers and raspberries in the nose, very fresh. Smell goes along the same lines but much more impressive and complex with a big burst of raspberry at the front and more flavours coming through as it warms up with a subtle wine like complexity. Absolutely brilliant.

I was able to enjoy this one at Redlight Redlight. Vintage was 2010 and bottled in 2013. This pours out a bright red with a light pink head. It has a nice sour funk in the nose. The flavor is tart and not overwhelming syrupy from the raspberries like you see with most framboise beers.

Sticker says 2010 and cork says 13. Pours bright cranberry red with a bit grayish pink head. Aroma brings subtle but pleasant tart and big fresh berry fruit. Flavor is on a whole different level, super fresh raspberries with subtle puckering being so fresh. Carbonation is right on, full body, and enhances the delicious fresh fruit raspberries. It is so smooth and fresh.

Pours hazy orange with a small pink head. Aroma of raspberry and wood notes. Dry, tart flavor that ends up solid sour and with bitter notes. Medium bodied, watery text. and soft carb. An excellen, crispt fruit lambic.

vintage 2009 (per sticker, doesnt have the label, per Jeans personal attention to the bottle), bottled 2012 per cork.

Thanks to Brandon and Emily for bringing this out from Paris!

Pours a simply gorgeous razzy red. Really lovely cherry blossom caps this one. Nose carries more funk than Id anticipated, really the earthy aspect of Cantillons arsenal. The raspberries come through acidic and sharp with hints of vinous shreds. Flavor carries surprising balance. The tartness and buxelles funk are soo well balanced with generous bounties of raspberries. The whole thing comes together and reminds me of a freshly picked raspberry during the high sun of an August day mixed with the grit of a solid days hike. A little full bodied with reserved carbonation accentuated the generous fruit endowment for the beer. Finish made me want another sip of the beer, and a gulp of ice cold water. Really a step up from the Rose, and I appreciate the attention to detail here.

Serving type: bottle

06-12-2012
Notes from backlog. A great acidity, more sour than Rose de Gambrinus but less raspberry flavors..

2010

Pours clear ruby, lighter than kriek, large pink, quickly dissipating head. 

Smell puckering sour raspberry. Fruity. Mouth watering raspberry. Funky and slightly musty. Bit sweet.

Taste huge tartness up front, less fruit than Rose de Gambrinus but more complex, more oak, dryer.

Lighter bodied, refreshing.

Gorgeous beer.

Bottle from etregourmet.be biershop, shared with the Die By the Beer crew during Bergen Ølfestival 2013. Nose is intense raspberry tones, lemon, voluminous fruity tones, spices and hints of hay. 2010 bottle. Thanks to DocJ007 for the share at our recent tasting.


A - Pours raspberry red with a nice one finger tall white head, dissipating down to a light film, leaving spotty trails of lace down part of the glass.


S - Smells of intense basement must and barnyard funk and not much else. Not a ton of fresh fruit which is a bit surprising with such a fresh bottle but it is still enjoyable.


T - Starts off with the strong must and funk combo that never really fades away. The raspberries come through a little more here but they are still more muted than I was expecting. Finish is still pretty musty with some lingering tartness. Not overly sour like some of the aged bottles I have had, but not as bright with the fruit either.
